div.p: Town in Lower Austria, c. 14 km (c. 9 miles) south of central Vienna.

In the 19th and early 20th centuries, Mödling was a separate town in Lower Austria. It was there that Arnold Schoenberg lived from 1918 to 1925. His house there is now a museum, under the administration of the Arnold Schönberg Center Private Foundation.
In 1938, after the annexation of Austria, Mödling was incorporated into Vienna as its 24th district. In 1954 it reverted to being a separate municipality in Lower Austria.
